intro: Myosotis versicolor, commonly known as the variable forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Myosotis versicolor is known for its variable coloration, which can range from white to deep blue depending on environmental conditions.
